verses.roman:
bahu-mūlya diyā āni' kariyā yatana
pavitra saṁskāra kari' kare nivedana

synonyms: bahu-mūlya—high price; diyā—offering; āni'-bringing; kariyā yatana—with great attention; pavitra—purified; saṁskāra kari'-trimming; kare nivedana—offers to the Deity.
translation: "All these fruits were collected from distant places and were bought at a high price. After trimming them with great care and purity, Rāghava Paṇḍita offered them to the Deity.
